page.title: 17Farming
page.content: Farming is quite a common job in the countryside. The farms in Stratton-on-the-Fosse and Chilcompton are mainly dairy farms. The cows are milked twice every day at about 0600 and 1600. They are taken into a milking parlour where they are milked by machine. The most modern parlour is a rotary one. About 8 cows stand on a revolving platform and can be milked at once. They must be fed properly so that they can give fresh milk. The milk is stored in a refrigerated tank until it is collected by milk tanker lorry. The tanker calls every day. Wheat, barley, potatoes and oil seed rape are the main crops grown in this area. Wheat is used for making bread, barley is used for making beer and oil seed rape is used for margarine.
